relation: go to the sand dunes, go to the club join an activity
very rarely do they serve a meal that is actually good and always check you dishes before using them!
Most kids live in the dorm and there is always something going on in the dorms. you'll make a lot of new friends if you just walk around for a bit
It depends on what type of classes you're taking, they have many different levels

Join something. get involved in a sport, join a club, go to the gatherings that the club sets up. The town is small but you can find plenty to do and people to meet on campus if put yourself into something.

A small, but close nit school located in southern Colorado. The town of Alamosa may be low-key but the students at ASU are always finding stuff to do. Class sizes and the sports are great and all around it has a great atmosphere.

TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {82543=Summerfest on the Rio in June is a big hit with lots of music, food and fun. The school itself also does fun events monthly around campus like movie night, concerts and many more., 22054=Stock up on the DVDs and take advantage of the on-campus cable. It's usually sunny and windy. In August it's really hot, but it gets cold quickly, really cold. Be prepared for professors to recognize you outside of class, they'll know when you're skipping., 171578=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC}

textAfterTable: Hannah from Centennial, CO 04/27/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 4 out of 4 people found this review useful. 2 of 44 Categories Comments Bang for the buck I am pretty ecstatic about how convenient the cost to go to Adams State is. It really is hard to find a quality college such as this one that has a low cost. ASC is really a hit when it comes to the financial matter. Am enjoying being here Coming from a the city of Denver, I have never been close to living in such a natural, small town like Alamosa. It is a big change coming from the city but I enjoy being here because there are a lot of outdoor activities to fill the day with. Am learning a lot I chose to rate my learning experience at Adams State College a four because all the professors that I have had classes with are more than eligible to teach in their
